oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Carte de Viste Lt. George W. Emmert, 13th Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lt. Emmert hailed from Carter Co. and was an avowed Unionist. He was arrested in 1861 by the Confederates for bridge burning but released. He recruited a company of men to join the Union army in Kentucky but he and his recruits were captured. He escaped and was sworn into US service as a recruiting officer in 1863. He recruited Co. C, 13th Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA and eventually served as second lieutenant. He survived the war and served as Circuit Court Clerk and in the Tenn. General Assembly.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Emmert, George W.
